alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Polk (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 4:44PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Floyd and Polk Counties through 515 PM EST... At 444 PM EST, a strong thunderstorm was near Cedartown, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Cedartown, Rockmart, Aragon, Seney, Fish Creek, Etna, Esom Hill, Antioch, Van Wert and Lindale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for northwestern Georgia.
